subject: Cleanup spec file
commitMessage:
Cleanup spec file

- Do not install sysvinit scripts
- Fixed group and license
- Remove bogus runtime requirements

Signed-off-by: Anas Nashif <anas.nashif@intel.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        succeeded      

 standard       x86_64         succeeded      

 standard       armv7l         succeeded      

 standard       i586           succeeded
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       armv7hl        unresolvable   

 standard       x86_64         failed         

 standard       armv7l         unresolvable   

 standard       i586           failed
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This will break sdb connection, usb-server call /etc/init.d/sdbd to start/stop sdbd.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Patch Set 1:

not really:

https://review.tizen.org/gerrit/gitweb?p=apps/core/preloaded/usb-manager.git;a=commitdiff;h=bbafdc3cb9d9d7b42ea87625fe5af4d64d823550


We should not use /etc/init.d  script in this way, if you want to run some executable then install it in /sbin or /bin, which is done in the patch above.

Patch Set 1:

please re-review base on comment provided

Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

if then, it looks good to me. But, is the code right?

sdbd executable has been installed to "/usr/sbin/sdbd"

 /* brad.t.peters@intel.com - todo - move away from sys-v init */
-#define SDBD_START            "/etc/init.d/sdbd start"
-#define SDBD_STOP             "/etc/init.d/sdbd stop"
+#define SDBD_START            "/sbin/sdbd"

Patch Set 1:

well, /sbin is a link to /usr/sbin, should point to physical path, but it should work now
Patch Set 1: Verified+1 Code-Review+1
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
